I am trying to write a TestCase class that needs to call setUp() and 
tearDown() just once for all testXXX() methods in it.  

I am a little new to the TestSetup utility in JUnit.  Can someone 
explain to me how exactly this works?  I know there is an example in 
the FAQ, but it's a little unclear whether the test case that 
contains the TestSetup wrapper in the suite() method actually 
contains the added test cases in it (as inner classes).  Also, is 
there a way to simply add testXXX() methods using suite.addTest()?

Thanks,
Jacqueline Guerrero
